conclusion: Wire ABC with segments AB and BC, each of length L, angle at B is 120 degrees, magnetic fields perpendicular to plane, strengths B, current I.
Formula for Ampere force: F = BIL sinθ.
Segments AB and BC in magnetic fields of strength B, fields pointing in opposite directions.
Segment AB in magnetic field pointing inward, current from A to B.
Force on AB: F_AB = BIL sinθ_AB.
Segment BC in magnetic field pointing outward, current from B to C.
Force on BC: F_BC = BIL sinθ_BC.
Total Ampere force is vector sum of F_AB and F_BC.
Wire ABC is perpendicular to magnetic fields, angle at B is 120 degrees.
Sketch: A, B, C form shape with angle at B as 120 degrees, segments AB and BC each of length L.
Magnetic field for AB into the plane, for BC out of the plane.
Angle between each segment and magnetic field should be considered.
Using right-hand rule for segment AB: force is upwards out of the plane.
Wire is lying flat on the plane, magnetic fields are perpendicular to the plane.
For AB: F_AB = BIL sin90° = BIL.
For BC: F_BC = BIL sin90° = BIL.
Both forces in the same direction seems odd, double-check using right-hand rule.
Using right-hand rule for AB: force is to the left of the page.
